channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pakistan bans hard-line Islamist party known for its fierce anti-blasphemy stance
item.description: Pakistan banned a hard-line Islamist party on Thursday, more than a week after heated clashes with police that left at least five people dead.

item.title: The federal government is still shut down. Here's what that means across the country
item.description: The federal government shutdown continues. Republicans and Democrats appear no closer to an agreement to end it. Many federal workers are missing full...

item.title: U.S. imposes sanctions on Colombia's president and family over drug trade allegations
item.description: The sanctions sharply escalate tensions with the leftist leader of a country that has traditionally been one of the closest U.S. allies in South Ameri...

item.title: Republicans Who Have Rarely Opposed Trump Raise Questions About His Drug War
item.description: The president said he wouldn’t seek congressional approval for his expanding military offensive against cartels, but some in his party believe Congres...

item.title: Speed Limits Are Taking the Wind Out of Cyclists’ Exhilarating Commutes
item.description: With new regulations on electric bike speed, fans of the gray Citi Bike — lovingly known as the White Stallion or the Ghost — are facing a slower, saf...

item.title: It's been a rollercoaster few years for Six Flags. Can Travis Kelce help?
item.description: Travis Kelce is teaming up with activist investors in hopes of transforming the embattled theme park operator Six Flags. No word yet on a Taylor Swift...

item.title: Lengthy Execution by Nitrogen Gas in Alabama Renews Concerns Over Method
item.description: Anthony Boyd was the eighth person executed by nitrogen gas since Alabama began using the method last year. His execution came over the strenuous obje...

item.title: U.S. Details How Mob and Ex-NBA Players Lured High Rollers Into Poker Trap
item.description: A Manhattan apartment was at the center of a Mafia-run ring that used former N.B.A. players as bait and technology to read cards, prosecutors say.

item.title: Coffee-driven deforestation is making it harder to grow coffee, watchdog group says
item.description: In Brazil's coffee-producing areas, more than 42,000 square miles of forest have disappeared over about two decades, says Coffee Watch. Deforestation ...

item.title: U.S. Deploys Aircraft Carrier to Latin America as Drug Operation Expands
item.description: The Trump administration has acknowledged 10 strikes on suspected drug-smuggling boats from South America, which have killed 43 people.

item.title: A Missing Picasso Is Found, and a Small Spanish Town Loses Its Air of Mystery
item.description: For a brief moment, the puzzle of what had happened to Pablo Picasso’s “Still Life With Guitar” infected Deifontes with caper fever.

item.title: Trump to Investigate Whether China Abided by 2020 Trade Deal
item.description: The administration announced its trade investigation on Friday, ahead of a summit between U.S. and Chinese leaders.

item.title: Ukraine’s ‘Coalition of the Willing’ Has the Wind at Its Back
item.description: Britain hosted a meeting of European leaders to discuss bolstering support for Kyiv as winter approaches.

item.title: U.S. Deploys Aircraft Carrier to Latin America as Drug Operation Expands
item.description: The Trump administration has acknowledged 10 strikes on suspected drug-smuggling boats from South America, which have killed 43 people.
